summary: This is a declaration by an Assistant U.S. Attorney in support of the FBI's motion for summary judgment in a FOIA lawsuit brought by Radar Online LLC. The declaration argues that records related to the investigations of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell should be withheld under FOIA Exemption 7(A) to avoid interfering with the then-pending Maxwell prosecution, scheduled for trial in November 2021.

persons.name: James Roberson
persons.context: Co-plaintiff with Radar Online LLC in a FOIA lawsuit against the FBI seeking records related to the Epstein investigation and prosecution.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of a pending federal prosecution for conspiracy, enticement, transportation, sex trafficking, and perjury related to her association with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier who was indicted on sex trafficking charges in July 2019; his prosecution is referenced as background for the FOIA request and the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The presiding judge in the case of United States v. Maxwell, who issued a protective order governing discovery.

persons.name: Michael G. Seidel
persons.context: Author of an FBI index declaration referenced in the FOIA litigation.

persons.name: Berman
persons.context: Judge who entered an order of nolle prosequi dismissing the charges against Jeffrey Epstein after his death.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as an individual who associated with Jeffrey Epstein, and the prosecution against her stems from this association.
The declarant is one of the prosecutors handling the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.
The declarant was one of the prosecutors in charge of the prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein prior to his death.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Indicted
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted by a federal grand jury in the SDNY on one count of conspiracy to commit sex trafficking and one count of sex trafficking.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein passed away while in custody.

events.title: Charges Against Epstein Dismissed
events.description: Following a public hearing, Judge Berman entered an order of nolle prosequi dismissing the charges against Jeffrey Epstein after his death.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Indicted
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was indicted by a grand jury in the SDNY on charges including conspiracy to entice minors, transportation of a minor, and perjury.

events.title: Maxwell Superseding Indictment
events.description: A grand jury returned a superseding indictment charging Ghislaine Maxwell with additional counts, including sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of a minor.

events.title: Scheduled Maxwell Trial
events.description: The trial for Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled to start on this date before Judge Alison J. Nathan.

keyFacts: The document is a declaration by a federal prosecutor arguing that releasing FBI records on Epstein and Maxwell would interfere with Maxwell's then-upcoming trial by influencing witnesses and jurors.
It reveals the government's concern about intense media coverage shaping public perception and potentially compromising a fair trial for Ghislaine Maxwell.
The withheld records include FBI interview notes, grand jury subpoenas, communications with other agencies, and background information on witnesses and subjects.
The government states it has provided Maxwell's defense with discoverable materials under a protective order but argues public FOIA disclosure would grant premature or greater access.
The declaration cites risks that witness testimony could be shaped if witnesses see other evidence or statements in the investigative file before trial.
